How to Install sfcb-test on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • sfcb-test

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install sfcb-test on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing sfcb-test on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall sfcb-test in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install sfcb-test, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install sfcb-test Using apt

To install sfcb-test in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install sfcb-test using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install sfcb-test

The installation of sfcb-test might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install sfcb-test Using apt-get

To install sfcb-test using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install sfcb-test.

sudo apt-get -y install sfcb-test

Install sfcb-test Using Synaptic

To install sfcb-test using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install sfcb-test on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for sfcb-test. This will display the sfcb-test package in the package window, now to install sfcb-test, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the sfcb-test package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of sfcb-test.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install sfcb-test Using aptitude

To install sfcb-test on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of sfcb-test.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install sfcb-test using the command aptitude install sfcb-test.

sudo aptitude -y install sfcb-test

How to Upgrade sfcb-test on debian

If you want to upgrade the sfcb-test package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade sfcb-test using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade sfcb-test to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade sfcb-test.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade sfcb-test sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade sfcb-test

Upgrade sfcb-test using Aptitude

To upgrade sfcb-test using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade sfcb-test.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade sfcb-test

Upgrade sfcb-test using Synaptic

To upgrade sfcb-test using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for sfcb-test, now right-click sfcb-test, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade sfcb-test just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall sfcb-test on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall sfcb-test from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just sfcb-test, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove sfcb-test

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of sfcb-test

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of sfcb-test you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge sfcb-test

Remove sfcb-test using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall sfcb-test using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for sfcb-test, right-click the sfcb-test package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall sfcb-test click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install sfcb-test on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade sfcb-test using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of sfcb-test then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
